item.title: Leg Ulcer
item.description: Ulcer - loss of area of epidermis and dermis to produce a defect even down to fat, muscle, tendons and bone

item.title: pyoderma gangrenosum
item.description: Pyoderma gangrenosum is a rare skin condition that causes painful ulcers. It’s usually treatable but can take some time to heal and may leave some scarring.

item.title: Sarcoidosis
item.description: Sarcoidosis is a rare inflammatory disease that can affect multiple organs, most commonly the lungs and lymph nodes. The condition is characterized by the formation of small clumps of inflammatory cells, known as granulomas, in various parts of the body.

item.title: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
item.description: Anti-DNA reaction so can present in any system Causes/Factors Symptoms Signs Diagnostic Tests Management Complications/red Flags
